titleStmt.title: James T. Tucker to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2379

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Winchester 11 Dec 1860
To His Exsellensy Gov Mcgoffin

A. J. Tribble Esq a justice of the Peace of Clarke County, having resigned &said offise, & his resignation havig ben assepted. Claibourne Lisle is suggested as a suitable person to fill his plase Lisle is a man of property, standing & high position in this county, & the truest Demcrat in the state, & I hope your Exsellensy will appoint him a justise of the pease of District Nov 5 Clarke County state of Ky to fill the plase vacated by A. F Tribble Esq with the highest regards I remain your Respectfully
We hartily concur in the above and further suggest that You attend ^to^ this at Your earlyest conivenence as court comes on in that District the 4th saturday in this month
A. L. Haggard P. J. C. C. C

Clarke Co
J. P.
Dist No 5
C. Lisle
vice
A. J. Tribble
Com Issd. Dec 13 1860
